com.github.luka5w.util.cli

Class Prompt

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.luka5w.util.cli.Prompt

  • public class Prompt
extends java.lang.Object
    Prompt

    Prompt user inputs in the commandline

    Experimental: Only tested for Linux (Terminal)

    GitHub: https://github.com/luka5w/javautils

        public static boolean promptYN(@Nullable
                               java.lang.String question)
        Prompts the user with the option yes or no.
        Parameters:
        question - The question the prompt is about.
        Returns:
        Whether the user selected yes or no.
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:

      • promptYN

        public static boolean promptYN(@Nullable
                               java.lang.String question,
                               @Nullable
                               java.lang.String prefix,
                               @Nullable
                               java.lang.String invalidInput)
        Prompts the user with the option yes or no.
        Parameters:
        question - The question the prompt is about.
        prefix - The prefix before the 'cursor'.
        invalidInput - The message which will be displayed when the user submits a wrong input.
        Returns:
        Whether the user selected yes or no.
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        promptYN(question, prefix, #YES, #NO, invalidInput, #MAX_PROMPTS)

      • promptYN

        public static boolean promptYN(@Nullable
                               java.lang.String question,
                               @Nullable
                               java.lang.String prefix,
                               @Nullable
                               java.lang.String yes,
                               @Nullable
                               java.lang.String no,
                               @Nullable
                               java.lang.String invalidInput,
                               int maxPrompts)
        Prompts the user with the option yes or no.
        Parameters:
        question - The question the prompt is about.
        prefix - The prefix before the 'cursor'.
        yes - The input value which will be interpreted as yes.
        no - The input value which will be interpreted as no.
        invalidInput - The message which will be displayed when the user submits a wrong input.
        maxPrompts - The maximal iterations before the prompt fails.
        Returns:
        Whether the user selected yes or no.
        Throws:
        TooMuchIterationException - When the maxPrompts limit exceeded.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • prompt

        public static java.lang.String prompt(java.lang.String prefix)
        Prompts the user with undefined options.
        Parameters:
        prefix - The prefix before the 'cursor'.
        Returns:
        The line, the user submitted.
        Since:
        1.0.0
